intro: Brownea guaraba, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsules as its fruit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Brownea guaraba thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil.
